result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey Alan Kowalchuk

records.addlTxt:
1:14 PM Defendant Jeffrey Alan Kowalchuk in court.  Attorney Annie E Getsinger in court for Jeffrey Alan Kowalchuk.  Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes warrant.  Atty Getsinger requests a preliminary hearing.  Matter reset.  Bond continues.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:21 PM Attorney Annie E Getsinger in court for Jeffrey Alan Kowalchuk.  Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  Atty Getsinger had been contacted by DE and he stated he was ill but no docs to provide.  Atty Getsinger responds/requests reset to next week.  State doesn't object to a short stay of any warrant but would prefer next week.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant but stays it until time/date of PH. State requests that not be the case so witnesses aren't unnecessarily called in.  Parties discuss.  Court stays warrant to 9/30/22 at 1pm for appearance of medical documentation.
Hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on September 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Absolute sobriety and must submit chemical testing if requested by law enforcement.

3:34 PM Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeffrey Alan Kowalchuk appeared by video, in custody from LEC w/atty. Getsinger. Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney. DE does qualify for PD representation.  State requests $200 Cash. Atty. Getsinger argues for signature bond.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $750.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: Absolute sobriety and must submit chemical testing if requested by law enforcement.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 12, 2022 at 10:15 am.
